observation: I can see a country/region selection page for Deriv. There's a dropdown showing 'Select' as placeholder text, with a long list of countries visible below it starting with Afghanistan, Albania, Algeria, etc. I need to select a country first before proceeding. As an elderly user, I can see the countries are well-formatted with flags and clear text, which is good for accessibility. I should select a country that's likely to be accepted by this financial platform.
reasoning: As a 70-year-old user, I need to select my country of residence to proceed with sign-up. Looking at the list, I can see many countries available. Since some financial platforms restrict certain countries, I'll select a commonly accepted one. I can see Australia in the list at element 71, which is typically accepted by most financial platforms and has good regulatory frameworks.
ux_issues: The dropdown list is very long without search functionality visible at the top, which could be challenging for elderly users to navigate

outcome.visual_observation: The dropdown menu for country/region selection remains closed and shows 'Select' placeholder text. No country options are visible and Australia was not selected.
outcome.diagnosis: The tap action did not successfully open the dropdown menu or select Australia. The dropdown appears to be non-functional or the tap target was missed.
